arm_group.description: Dexmedetomidine infusion, without a bolus dose, (or a comparable volume of placebo) will be initiated before the surgical incision at a rate of 0.1 kg/hr; at the end of bypass, the dose will be increased to 0.2 kg/hr.

brief_summary.textblock: Ancillary Effects of Dexmedetomidine Sedation After Cardiac Surgery

clinical_study.brief_title: Ancillary Effects of Dexmedetomidine Sedation After Cardiac Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigator goal is to evaluate the effects of intraoperative and postoperative
      dexmedetomidine sedation (versus placebo after cardiac surgery.

intervention.description: Normal saline administration matching dexmedetomidine rate of infusion

clinical_study.official_title: Ancillary Effects of Dexmedetomidine Sedation After Cardiac Surgery

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: To measure whether dexmedetomidine sedation decreases the incidence of atrial arrhythmias.
primary_outcome.measure: Sedation Outcome of patients assigned to dexmedetomidine or placebo.
